intro: Bugula chamaepithys, commonly known as the common sea grape, is a marine plant belonging to the order Bryopsidales. It is characterized by its dense, branching structure and is typically found in shallow coastal waters. The plant has a thallus composed of numerous small, cup-like structures called conceptacles. These conceptacles are involved in gas exchange and reproduction. Bugula chamaepithys plays an important role in marine ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various organisms.
